page.title: 09EDUCATION
page.content: Orton School was opened on the 25th of May 1963.There are 44 children in attendance in 1985.The children are in three classes, with 16 in the upper juniors, 12 in the lower juniors and 16 infants.The teachers are Mr Falshaw who is the headmaster, Mrs Bellwood, and Mrs Readhead who, comes every morning.Mrs Boynton is the school cook and she is helped by Mrs Tyson.There are two classrooms with a central hall joining the two class rooms.The gardener is called Mr Lightfoot and he has been cutting the lawns and planting flowers for 3 years.In the school grounds there are two bird tables.The school grounds cover just under an acre. When the children are 11 years old they transfer to Kirkby Stephen Grammar school which is 16 miles away.They travel there by bus.
